section.title: What is Apache Maven?
section.para: Apache Maven is a Java based build tool geared around reusable plugins, and dependencies. It provides a standardized approach to developing software which follow common patterns.

Maven projects build what are called artifacts, and are organized by three components: groupId, artifactId, and version. The groupId is generally shared amongst multiple artifacts and refers to either a company, or a project - a groupId usually follows Javaâ€™s package naming conventions of a reserved domain name - eg. com.smxemail.testapp.
